active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate how data replication integrity failures could lead to regulatory non-compliance (e.g., GDPR data accuracy requirements or HIPAA integrity mandates). Provide examples from real-world incidents like the 2021 Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack and propose two preventive measures.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Topic: Data Replication Integrity Failures (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > Data Architecture Vulnerabilities > Data Flow Architecture Vulnerabilities > Data Replication Integrity Failures). Voter consensus: 87.1% approval. **Completed Research Context:** Data replication ensures HA, DR, performance but risks integrity failures (corruption, loss, inconsistency, staleness). Causes: network issues (packet loss, partitions), hardware failures, software bugs, misconfigurations, human error, attacks (ransomware). Impacts CIA triad. Standards: NIST SP 800-53 (SI-7 Software/Firmware/Information Integrity, SC-23 Session Authenticity); NIST SP 1800-25 'Data Integrity: Identifying and Protecting Assets Against Ransomware'; ISO 27001 (A.12.2.1 Malware Controls, A.8.1 Asset Management); CIS Controls v8 (Control 3 Data Protection, Control 13 Data Recovery). Best practices: checksums, quorum, monitoring (AWS DMS validation). **Sources:** - NIST SP 800-53r5: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-53r5.pdf - NIST SP 1800-25: https://www.nccoe.nist.gov/publication/1800-25 - ISO 27001:2022: https://www.iso.org/standard/27001 - CIS Controls v8: https://www.cisecurity.org/controls/v8 - AWS DMS Best Practices: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/dms/latest/userguide/CHAP_BestPractices.html - CAP Theorem: Brewer, 'Towards Robust Distributed Systems' (ACM 2000). **Prior Knowledge:** CIA triad, basic replication (sync/async), HA/DR, CAP. **Learning Objectives:** [Insert full list from above]. **Scaffolding Layers:** [Insert full list from above]. **Active Learning:** Use for scenario inspiration [Insert summaries]. Generate 50 flashcards using the exact schema: MCQ front (4 options), back with answer/explanation/Bloom/ref. Ensure distractors follow protocol. Balance: 30% Layer1-2 (foundational), 40% Layer3 (practical), 30% Layer4 (advanced). Cover all objectives. Output as numbered list: --- Card 1 --- Front: ... Back: ... ---
